[DhtmlXQ_move_0_22_288]00096353504021315868535109494737[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_22_288]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_22_289]000563535040213105454757[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_22_289]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_19_290]62650009213109494737172737385848[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_19_290]
[DhtmlXQ_move_290_21_291]655551415535092921314140858429273537273747374224[/DhtmlXQ_move_290_21_291]
[DhtmlXQ_move_291_23_292]5558094958484929483829213832212747482757324241518584172784742737[/DhtmlXQ_move_291_23_292]
[DhtmlXQ_move_292_30_293]2129324241514748295985841727847427377464595848493738[/DhtmlXQ_move_292_30_293]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_19_294]62630009635351415358172758380949475749593858593958482737575839694846696858593738[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_19_294]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_19_295]6242007042415152473717273738272838377000[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_19_295]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_16_296]20402131402031212000[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_16_296]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_13_297]483817273141403041313000[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_13_297]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_12_298]40203141575848382030413130003141[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_12_298]
[DhtmlXQ_move_0_7_299]797042603141584849595758[/DhtmlXQ_move_0_7_299]
[DhtmlXQ_comment0]This is perhaps the most famous end game composition in the history of chinese chess. It is mentioned in every major chess manual. ||||It may look simple but there are hundreds of variations. If optimal play was done, it would be a draw  but both Red and Black have their chances.||七星聚会 when translated directly would mean the gathering of the seven stars. This is because other than the kings, both red and black have 7 pieces.||This is also one of the most complex endgames there is, to date, having survived hundreds of years.[/DhtmlXQ_comment0]
[DhtmlXQ_comment1]Red tries to checkmate with R2+9 or R3+9[/DhtmlXQ_comment1]
[DhtmlXQ_comment2]Now, red cannot move R2+9 or R3+9 or Black will win with E5-7![/DhtmlXQ_comment2]
[DhtmlXQ_comment5]This red move is to provide a root for red's 6th file pawn...[/DhtmlXQ_comment5]
[DhtmlXQ_comment7]Only way for red to save himself.[/DhtmlXQ_comment7]
[DhtmlXQ_comment12]This move is key for black, After this check, black has the initiative. The variations from now on are basically in the black attack, red defend format.[/DhtmlXQ_comment12]
[DhtmlXQ_comment16]In the ancient manual, the following moves were made but they have been cancelled because the proceeding moves are the same. Please see the variation of R3=5[/DhtmlXQ_comment16]
[DhtmlXQ_comment19]Very important for red to make these few moves in this order or he will lose.[/DhtmlXQ_comment19]
[DhtmlXQ_comment21]If black repeated the following moves, it would be a check followed by a threatening to kill move. This is not allowed and Red must change his moves, according to the Chinese Xiangqi rules. HOWEVER, if they were to abide by the AXF rules, this would be a draw.[/DhtmlXQ_comment21]
[DhtmlXQ_comment22]Black cannot move R1+5 and try to take the red pawn. He would lose dearly! See the variation of R1+5.[/DhtmlXQ_comment22]
[DhtmlXQ_comment25]Red must make this move or be killed with Black's P2+1.[/DhtmlXQ_comment25]
[DhtmlXQ_comment31]Red attempts a counter kill of his own. Good move![/DhtmlXQ_comment31]
[DhtmlXQ_comment37]Red attempts a kill of his own.[/DhtmlXQ_comment37]
[DhtmlXQ_comment43]Correct move![/DhtmlXQ_comment43]
[DhtmlXQ_comment49]Red K5=4 ... and black would win with E5+7![/DhtmlXQ_comment49]
[DhtmlXQ_comment52]The two Black chariot checks were not included in the ancient manual.[/DhtmlXQ_comment52]
[DhtmlXQ_comment57]The central pawn is protected! Good and correct move![/DhtmlXQ_comment57]
[DhtmlXQ_comment85]The 3rd game in the ancient manual. DRAW![/DhtmlXQ_comment85]
[DhtmlXQ_comment1_71]Red is in deep trouble.[/DhtmlXQ_comment1_71]
[DhtmlXQ_comment1_80]Variation 11 of the 3rd game. Red is disadvantaged and black will win eventually![/DhtmlXQ_comment1_80]
[DhtmlXQ_comment2_94]Red has no answer for black's eventual kill!||Black wins.[/DhtmlXQ_comment2_94]
[DhtmlXQ_comment3_72]This moves looks ok but is actually a bad move. Black should have moved E5+7.[/DhtmlXQ_comment3_72]
[DhtmlXQ_comment3_73]Red should have moved R6=4 to gurantee a win! Now it is a draw.[/DhtmlXQ_comment3_73]

[DhtmlXQ_comment248_27]低车红二路局。||By traversing the chariot to the 2nd file, this would constitute one of the more famous variations in the Gathering of the Seven Stars. Other names in Chinese include  It 红车平至二路，俗称“大撇车”或者“双撇车”。[/DhtmlXQ_comment248_27]
[DhtmlXQ_comment248_31]This variation is also called “双撇车” in Chinese.[/DhtmlXQ_comment248_31]

[DhtmlXQ_comment273_53]Victory to Red.[/DhtmlXQ_comment273_53]
[DhtmlXQ_comment274_47] According to the rules that was used by the public in ancient times, if Black's moves were an alternate check and mating threat, and Red was forced to answer with a mating threat of his own, Black needed to change his moves or lose. That is why, in this situation, Black must change his moves or lose. Unfortunately, there were better options. Victory to Red.[/DhtmlXQ_comment274_47]

[DhtmlXQ_comment282_29]6th Sub-variation of Major Variation.[/DhtmlXQ_comment282_29]
[DhtmlXQ_comment282_39] It would be illegal for Black to perpetually traverse his pawn to attempt a kill. Unfortunately, there would be no better move for Black to make, and Red would have successfully employed the rules to his favor. Red would be prepared to play P7=6 for the win.　[/DhtmlXQ_comment282_39]
